intro: Demorchis effusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved demorchis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
